storyInfo: The Stultifera sinks in the heat of battle, and a brand new expedition is crushed by the ocean. The extraordinarily ordinary Jordi manages to save the most lives of all, but no one comes to the rescue of Iberia and Ægir.

attributes.content: This... isn't possible.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: If true, then this whole time, the Abyssal Hunters have been looking for something right under their noses.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What that possibility signifies is too vile to put into words.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From beginning to end, the Eye of Iberia has always born witness to the aftermath of calamity. But it is just a sinking eyeball, unable to speak.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...What does this mean?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: It means Ægir's demise is accelerating.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It means that... if even cities at this distance are sending out distress signals, then the Stultifera Navis has been circling above their nest since the very beginning.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...The Hunters are all in danger.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know what you're thinking, but we have only one ship and the two of us.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Saving the Stultifera was not realistic.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You may not mind a few Abyssal Hunters dying at sea, but what we would be strangling in its cradle is opportunity. For both Ægir and Iberia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dario died a warrior's death. Wouldn't you want to gain some valuable knowledge from the mouth of the surviving Inquisitor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This is our last chance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No. A powerless city, almost reduced to ruins. How many Ægir have already fallen to the ocean?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We must act cautiously, or we will be leaping into the flames.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Even so, this is our last chance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If we wait until Ægir can no longer respond, until another Silence has fallen over Iberia, then indeed, the true enemy will appear.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But at that point, would it matter?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I understand you have your responsibilities. You don't want to take any risks until the Penal Battalion has full control over this place.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So I'll go alone.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...I know better than to underestimate the power of you and your pet, but it's a long trip. Are you sure you'll make it on your own?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The Hunters bleed a special kind of blood. Sea Terrors aren't necessarily that hostile towards ordinary ships.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can only hope you didn't just make that up to assuage my fears.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: That's not a lie I would have come up with anyway. Regardless, I can't leave the Hunters behind.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You'd better bring back the Hunters and Irene, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ah, um...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Is there anything I can do to help?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Mon3tr, survey our surroundings. If those Sea Terrors went back into hiding underwater, don't rile them up.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We need time, since the ship's taken some damage from the trip.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Answers with a nod)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: This ship...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The one the Hunters took was left by the Inquisition's spies.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Lord Carmen's original plan was to join up with the Penal Battalion at Gran Faro, establish a frontline headquarters, and push forward on a medium-sized naval vessel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So, this lone boat, abandoned on the shores of Gran Faro, is our final hope.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I, I can help... I'll go take a look at the boat. I've never actually repaired a ship before, but I do have some tools with me.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Um, can you really head out to sea on something like this?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If you don't think so, then probably not— Wait!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Out of the way, Jordi!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Woah, huh?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: S-Sea Terrors?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Waaaaah—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: They were hiding in the shadow of the reef? Mon3tr!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Screeches excitedly)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Jordi! Get off the boat!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I, I can't, something's pushing on it! The anchor's gone!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll try to steer it back—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jump off! The Sea Terrors are swarming around it!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Mon3tr, go rescue him.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Wait, wait— Then we'd lose the boat then! I, I'll try to steer it back! Urgh!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Watch out behind you!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Save Jordi first.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Cheers in response)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Whirlpools, changing currents, and the Sea Terrors are unusually active again... What's going on here?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Stretches out claws)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You want me to grab on and fly back with you? But, then the boat will— Woah?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (Screeches urgently)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Jordi knows that if doesn't take this opportunity, then he'll drift into the endless ocean along with the ship.
There's no other choice. He has to return to the Eye of Iberia and hide inside the lighthouse.
Just like he hid in that little town for over a decade.
Just like he hid when Dario died.
Just like with Thiago.
He clings to the mast to avoid falling into the aberrant waves. Mon3tr is visibly dissatisfied, urging him on.
Sea Terrors leap from the water's surface from time to time, darting back and forth rapidly and kicking up plumes of water. The Eye of Iberia is already becoming smaller and smaller.
He sees words carved crookedly into the boat's mast:
'Gran Faro'
...I will go in Kal'tsit's place.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: All I have to do is... find that ship, and bring everyone back, right? That doesn't sound too hard...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Compared to losing the ship and waiting helplessly under the lighthouse... it's a gamble I have to take!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I can do this on my own!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As long as even one of our kin touches upon the ultimate answer to life, we will be able to re-weave the laws of the cosmos from beginning to end.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Before we are given our next Revelation, we shall find a way.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Even if Ishar'mla refuses to answer. Even if our kind will never know the divine Will.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We will still survive.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Shark.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hmm.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our kin have conveyed their will. Nutrients are sufficient. No longer must we feed on each other.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I should return to the nest. You should come with me.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Running away so soon?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It barely took any damage, but the ship's in tatters.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You're still going on about that stuff, Amaia? Why don't just stay put and let me kill you like a good girl?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Our kind calls me back. They call for me to share my fruits with them.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I shall heed their call. When that is done, I shall heed your call. I shall seek you out, and you shall kill me.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Haha... Of course I can't let you leave. If I let you go, how many Seaborn just like you are going to end up all over the place?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Amaia sure knows how to make things hard for me. If only she were as simple and straightforward as Quintus.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What a shame I couldn't keep her around with that dance.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You talk too much, scum!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Ishar-mla. I've always wanted to meet you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: What happened? Why doesn't He speak anymore? Where is He?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Pah... It's like hacking at water. No resistance at all.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Are you Him? Is He you?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I have no idea what you're talking about. If you mean that big guy, He's already dead.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Death. Withering. He exists beyond these concepts. His voice, by no means signifies the end of life.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: What do your kind call Him? The same as those cultists? Your 'god' has already withered and fallen into the abyss.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: God?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: No. This is what we call Him—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.text: The hardship we suffer is ever present.
The life we thirst for is ever present.

attributes.content: Ishar-mla. Once more, I feel His pulse.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Kin. You swam together to His abode in the abyss, where even death drowns.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We have lost contact with Him, but His choices can only lead to the future.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Kin, your information... Nay, the flow of your emotions.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You feel it, Ishar-mla. Because you have left the arid land and returned home.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our blood flows in your veins. His blood flows in your veins. You are Him.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I am the Abyssal Hunter, Skadi.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: No matter. As you say, thus you are. Abyssal Hunter, Ska-di.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ishar-mla, we await His answer. Be it on the other end of time, He will answer us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Until then, until our answer finally comes—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —We many shall live on.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Gladiia silently appears behind the Seaborn, the lance in her hand actually puncturing the creature's body.
It is followed immediately by the cacophony of a whirling chainsaw.
Too slow. You're becoming weak, so just accept getting turned into paste.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Nngh—!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —Too shallow, it's not good enough! Ugh!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The heat of the sweltering flames sweeps down the long corridor. The Stultifera is groaning.
The Seaborn does not attack the vulnerable Skadi.
It simply stares at her in silence. A very strange sensation. Just like at Sal Viento.
It is 'watching' her, Skadi thinks.
Ugh, the ship is... at its limit. It'll start sinking very soon.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: It's trying to get away! Argh!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Below you!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Don't move, monster.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I won't allow you to return to the sea.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You are pitifully weak, human. Even as nutrition, you are not enough to nourish our kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Now that nutrients are plentiful, we require only time.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: This place is far from your territory. You have no reason to interfere with us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You and your kind cannot be judged by the law. I don't think I have any means of eradicating you for Iberia either.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Law? Burdensome rules of survival, as Amaia once said.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Compared to our kin, you are indeed too weak.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —But I will not let you escape, ocean scum.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: This is the last shot.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And sure enough, I can't even... *cough*... leave a scar on you...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Emotional. How strange, human. You are so weak, driven by emotions, trying to escape my hunger.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Escape, yes. Escape. Fear? But why do you still stand here then? Why do you attack me? Why... do you not flee from me?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Do you... also wish to make a contribution to 'we many'?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Who gave you the right to interrogate me?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The Seaborn no longer speaks. The creature before it is not kin.
Predation does not require the tool called language.
But before it can strike, a shadow drops down from the darkness of the ceiling.
Alfonso?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Tch. Haven't seen the color of its blasted blood since it became like this.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: This hunt— *spit*. Is almost over. You killed my chief mate, and you WILL pay.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You both, paradoxical beings. You still refuse to become our kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You have eaten many of us. Yet you refuse to become part of us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Make your choice. Not much time remains.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Hunt, acquire nutrients, return to we many.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Or, cease your bodily movements, give up the gift of life, and pass it on to our other kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Choose.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: ...Irene.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Yes! Um, why are you calling my name, though?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Tell me, do you have a way to return to land?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: But I must go back.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I can't stand against the Seaborn, but Iberia can. I'll carry this final warning with me. What happened to all of you, what Gladiia saw, I must bring all of it back.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You're starting to sound like a Messenger.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...That's fine. I can be whatever I want.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But I must go back.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Ngh?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: My ship is about to sink.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Sixty years. It's been over sixty years. But because of your arrival, we must now face the end.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Tell me.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: How does Iberia remember the great Captain Alfonso?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: 'Alfonso Under the Pomegranate Tree'. 'The Hero, Alfonso.' 'The Sunken Alfonso.'
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: There are many people... who held onto hope that the Stultifera never sank. But we weren't able to head out to sea.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: If... If you really are Lord Alfonso...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You have become a paragon to countless Iberian soldiers.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hmph... Pomegranate tree, huh... How pretentious.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: A flash of intense passion shimmers across the captain's eyes.
Since the dark clouds and turbulent waves trapped them inside this cage, few things have ever stirred his heart.
It's gotten weaker.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I'll hold it back.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: E-Explosions?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I thought the Originium boilers got knocked out of commission a long time ago, but the impact just now seems to have ignited the engine.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The flames will spread upward. I've always wondered how these things taste flame-grilled.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The heat makes the Seaborn uncomfortable.
It has become weak. Its kin are encircling it. It is unable to reach the sea.
It screams. But its calls are not answered.
No. Kin are coming. Closer. It can hear the voices of its kin.
They speak—
Die.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Gladiia does not hesitate. Skadi and Specter sever its body.
It tries to regenerate. It tries to break free. But this time, Alfonso clings to its body in a death grip.
He makes use of his already mutated arm.
It feels its lifeforce slipping away.
It sees Specter raise her weapon again.
Goodbye, Amaia.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Let's write off the debt this time.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What? You want to talk to her again? What can that filth possibly say that's worth hearing?
attributes.name: Sal Viento Bishop

attributes.content: You don't understand, Quintus.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: She told me about her life in Ægir.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: So what? If you want knowledge, a Herald can tell you far more.
attributes.name: Sal Viento Bishop

attributes.content: All we need to do is summon the Voice of the Deeps, and you will be able to obtain anything you want.
attributes.name: Sal Viento Bishop

attributes.content: That's why I said you don't understand, Quintus.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What I want to deconstruct, to witness, to caress, to break... has never been those cities. On land or in water, it's all the same.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I want to hear about their lives. About the wonderful lives they once had, about how they built their society, about how they defended their home.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: About how they cannibalized each other. About how they met their destruction, just like us.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Like us?
attributes.name: Sal Viento Bishop

attributes.content: The people who defile Ægir are Ægirs like you. The people who defile Iberia are Iberians like me.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Heh... The results of the experiment are already plain as day. If we still need more comparisons, she'll go mad and hate us.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: She'll hate us, and to be honest, I hate them too. Self-destructive soldiers. A self-righteous country. Falling into a self-inflicted trap.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But sometimes... You have to admit that we're more like them, more like humans, than we are like Seaborn.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: We'll probably be fighting forever.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: —It worked!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hey, Captain Alfonso, are you alright?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Compared to my ship, not half bad.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Are you really dead, Amaia? It can't be that easy, can it?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Limbs twitch)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Don't waste your breath on it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Convulsing) Lauren...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I'm here. I'm right here.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Seems like our positions are reversed now, Amaia.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Too bad for you, I've never... been one for science experiments. Not in the slightest.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Quivers with torn muscles)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Go ahead and die, you inferior, evolution-crazed creature.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: And be forgotten.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...That should settle things.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Seaborn. Even more Seaborn are nearby. They're approaching.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: And this ship's about to go down.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Even when my consciousness was hazy, I was still aware of how much effort it took for us to get here. Seems like we'll be running up against another wall.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Did you get what you came for, Swordfish?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ulpianus took it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's our fault that we failed to preserve the prototype technology on this ship, but...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That doesn't mean we came here in vain.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Captain.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It doesn't matter. Garcia already said that today's the last day of our voyage.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...For a long, long time, our will to survival has been slowly eaten away.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: At first, our greatest enemies were anxiety, suspicion, uncertainty, and fear. But later...
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Our emotions started drifting away from us. A longing for the ocean gnawed at our nerves, and one after another one, we forgot the glory of being a crewmember of the Stultifera Navis.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I watched them jump into the sea one by one, or I beheaded them before they could. I admit... that was a bit extreme.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: This long nightmare of survival has finally come to an end.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Seawater is pouring into the ship. This whole place is being eaten by the nethersea brand.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Inquisitor, this technology here, these Originium boiler techniques, will they be useful to the current Iberia?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Everything on the Stultifera is a precious national treasure. Ever since the Profound Silence, Iberia has had a large amount of Islander technology that cannot be reproduced.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And it's not just because we lost our fleet and our cities. Because of the judgment we passed on the Ægir, we lost so much of our talent too.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It was... necessary. Even now, I don't think that a soft-hearted strategy full of kindness could have combatted the Church of the Deep.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: If, today, we are forced to lose Stultifera Navis—the Ship of Fools—then I think... it would be a heavy blow, but it's something that was doomed to happen from the start.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hmph, hogwash. The state religion's always been like this.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Ægirs.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Take care of the Iberian. She can't swim back.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...That I can promise you.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The explosions are getting worse—this side's leaning!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We need to go, Skadi. Cut off a bit of the rafters above you!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hurry! Irene!
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I, I know! But what about Alfonso?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: How far will the currents take us? Or are we going to go around in circles? Isn't this place on top of their nest?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Regardless, looks like we're going to have to swim back.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: W-What?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Go. Get the hell off of my ship, like I told you from the start.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Just go. I'll stay here. This is my Iberia, and the captain goes down with the ship.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Alfonso slowly lowers himself into the throne. He closes his eyes.
The warmth of the bright Iberian sun as it splashes at an angle across the deck.
The aroma of a winery. The melody of his hometown.
A damp and empty room. Freshly burgeoning petri dishes.
The ocean's waves.
The ocean he once knew. The warmth of Garcia's hand. Breogan's lonely countenance. Carmen's smile. His comrades' roars resonating through the sky.
He opens his eyes, and lets out a hearty laugh as everything is consumed by the flames.
His laughter crosses through time, until it reaches a small town of pomegranate flowers, where one can smell the sea upon the breeze, and mingles with the first cries of a newborn child.
Alfonso. That is what the people call him.
He lifts his old, rusty blade, and places it against his neck. He prays. He laughs.
Hah. What a joke! Remember this well, Irene! Return to land and sing the praises of Alfonso's feats!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The last monster that Alfonso slew... was himself!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The ship breaks apart.
The glow of the flame blankets a sea that had been silent for nearly a hundred years.
An era comes to an end.
A legend passes into history.
In the distance, the sun rises.
Here sinks the Stultifera, and with it, the long-cherished wishes of Iberia, nay, of all civilization.
All succumbing to calamity.
What's the matter?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I think I heard... a voice.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: No, it must be my old age. These things happen.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Lord Carmen...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're crying?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Water?
Right...
The Stultifera... sank.
I'm in the ocean? The ocean... is a dangerous place.
It's dangerous, yes.
I have to return to Iberia!
Glub—! Gurgle—!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Stop trying to breathe like that. Underwater breathing is beyond you. Most Ægirs can't either.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I want to say something in return. But of course, I am underwater, and cannot.
Despite trying to contain my instincts, I can't help but clutch at her clothes like a helpless child.
But, I can see it.
The light reflected in her pupils.
It comes from the bottom of the sea.
Specter does not say anything, but I can feel her arms trembling slightly around me.
Maybe because of the battle we just fought? Maybe? Or, something to do with the light?
I'll bring you back up. Hang on tight.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: —Glub!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: My vision blurs.
So that's... what the bottom of the ocean... looks like.
Then—
—Is this Ægir?
The Seaborn quietly watches the distant flames disappearing beneath the waters.
The ship sinks into the ocean. Along with the flames. Along with everything.
Its kin answer its call. They all return to the many.
Surrounded by the many's embrace, it takes only a moment for the dying to be given new life.
Ishar-mla. I will bring you all, back home.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: —Let's all, die together, with Alfonso.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: The chief mate grips the Seaborn in its jaws and charges all the way into the seabed's murky darkness.
Its lover. Its memories. Its identity. As its charge slows, its consciousness dissolves into the ocean.
But still it bites down on the Seaborn.
The waters, make you nostalgic. Swim, and you will awaken.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Accept it. You are one of we many. We have long awaited you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: I am... Garcia... I am... Alfonso's...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Then why did you stop swimming? Your signal is just like mine.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Your wounds have all healed. You are accepting who you are.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: No—!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Why no?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The Chief Mate's consciousness is blurring.
Is it biting down on this Seaborn? Or, is it leaping into the Seaborn's embrace, seeking its succor?
It... It is forced to accept.
The sea makes it very comfortable. The Seaborn's thoughts flood into its mind.
Is it Garcia, Chief Mate of the Stultifera?
No, it is a Seaborn. It is one of we many—
Glub... (sounds of bubbles being blown) Gurgle... (sounds of bubbles popping)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You will die a human being, Garcia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: A step up from Amaia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Ul...pianus... Kin...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Thank... you...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Ulpianus watches the two sink to the bottom of the ocean, seemingly locked in an embrace beyond death. Like flowers growing side-by-side, they shrink, and wither. And beyond a certain depth, they are carried away by the undercurrent.
He does not lift his head until they are completely out of sight.
Why?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Gladiia, you must heed my warnings.
attributes.name: Ulpianus
